etymologies: Old English hwǣte of Germanic origin; related to Dutch weit, German Weizen, also to white

definitions: a cereal plant that is the most important kind grown in temperate countries, the grain of which is ground to make flour for bread, pasta, pastry, etc.

notes.text: Genus Triticum, family Gramineae: several species, including bread wheat (T. aestivum) and durum wheat, and many distinctive cultivars

shortDefinitions: cereal which is most important kind grown in temperate countries

definitions: the grain of the wheat plant.
